newsitem.title: CHINA: Phone calls in Shanghai rise 16 percent in 1995.
newsitem.headline: Phone calls in Shanghai rise 16 percent in 1995.

text.p: The number of phone calls made in Shanghai totalled nearly 8 billion in 1996, 16 percent more than in the previous year, the Liberation Daily reported on Wednesday.

The newspaper said the number of calls was growing on the back of a huge increase in the number of installed telephones. At the end of 1996 Shanghai had 2.59 million telephone subscribers compared with 370,000 in 1990.
The paper said the rate of successful connections during peak hours in 1996 rose 8.7 percentage points to 65 percent from the 1995 rate.
